page.title: 04Ecology
page.content: The Newport on Tay area lies at the mouth of the Firth of Tay. This river is the main feature in the environment. It is tidal at this point and very fast and clean. At low tide there are many sandbanks and mudflats inhabited by seals, waders, small sea-birds and sea ducks. We also get geese in winter. Salmon, sea trout and flatfish can be caught. The banks and shores are stony and hold a lot of semi-precious stones. Behind Wormit and Newport lie wooded hills and sheep, cattle and crop farms. The woods are inhabited by small wild birds and mammals; hawks, deer, foxes etc.. The weather is quite dry with low rainfall. In the Spring we get very annoying haars and sea mists because we are near the North Sea. We get little snow.
